{"step_by_step_thinking": "Transfusion Related Acute Lung Injury (TRALI) is a serious complication of blood transfusion. It is characterized by acute respiratory distress and non-cardiogenic pulmonary edema. The symptoms of TRALI usually occur within 6 hours of transfusion and typically resolve within 48-72 hours, not 2-3 weeks. Supportive care, including oxygen therapy and mechanical ventilation if necessary, is indeed the mainstay of treatment. The role of steroids in the management of TRALI is controversial and not well established. The mortality rate of TRALI is reported to be less than 10%.", "answer_choice": "A"}
